abstract.p: Monica Seles beats Fang Li and Steffi Graf beats Mary Joe Fernandez in second round matches at Bank of West women's tournament in Stanford, Calif (S)

block.p: BANK OF THE WEST Seles and Graf Win
Monica Seles used experience and stamina to outlast unseeded Fang Li, 2-6, 6-2, 6-1, last night in the Bank of the West women's tournament in Stanford, Calif.

Li came out strong, making some seemingly impossible shots against the second-seeded Seles, who is ranked No. 6 in the world. But the more experienced Seles appeared unruffled as she easily took the next two sets.
BANK OF THE WEST Seles and Graf Win
Monica Seles used experience and stamina to outlast unseeded Fang Li, 2-6, 6-2, 6-1, last night in the Bank of the West women's tournament in Stanford, Calif.

Li came out strong, making some seemingly impossible shots against the second-seeded Seles, who is ranked No. 6 in the world. But the more experienced Seles appeared unruffled as she easily took the next two sets.
In another match, Steffi Graf defeated Mary Joe Fernandez, 6-4, 6-0. The fourth-seeded Graf, ranked No. 57, has a 15-0 career record against Fernandez. (AP)
Bernd Karbacher upset fourth-seeded Alberto Berasategui in three hard-fought sets yesterday at the Generali Open in Kitzbuhel, Austria.
Karbacher, whose ranking has plummeted to 178th from 22d the past three years, reached the third round with his 4-6, 6-4, 7-6 (7-5) victory.
Thomas Muster also moved into the third round by slipping past Jan Kroslak, 6-2, 4-6, 6-2.
The fifth-seeded Muster next will play the defending champion, Filip DeWulf. (AP)
MERCEDES-BENZ CUP Hot Day for Black
Seventh-seeded Byron Black beat Gianluca Pozzi, 6-3, 6-2, yesterday in the second round of the Mercedes-Benz Cup in Los Angeles.

6-7 (1-7), 7-6 (7-3), in a match that lasted 2 hours 47 minutes in temperatures that reached the high 90's. Raoux, a semifinalist last year, had upset third-seeded Goran Ivanisevic in the opening round. In another match, Michael Joyce eliminated Sargis Sargsian, 6-3, 4-6, 6-2.
Black credited his consistency and experience for the victory. I've beaten him five times in a row, three times this year, Black said. I know how to play him. I think he's psyched out against me.(AP)
